citation.article-title: Paracoccus caeni sp. nov., isolated from sludge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paracoccus caeni sp. nov.
Paracoccus caeni (ca.e′ni. L. gen. neut. n. caeni of sludge).
Cells are Gram-negative and non-motile, 0.4–0.6 µm wide and 1.4–1.7 µm long.
After 3 days on R2A agar, colonies are 1–2 mm in diameter, smooth, pale yellow, circular and convex and contain PHB granules.
Growth occurs on R2A agar, nutrient agar, TSA, MacConkey agar and LB agar.
In LB broth, grows at 25–30 °C (optimum 30 °C), but not at 4 or 37 °C, at pH 6.0–9.0 (optimum pH 6.5–7.0) and with 0−6 % NaCl (optimum 3–4 % NaCl).
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrogen gas.

Positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase (C8) and leucine arylamidase, but negative for β-glucosidase (aesculin hydrolysis), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, arginine dihydrolase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase (o-nitrophenyl β-galactoside and p-nitrophenyl d-galactopyranoside hydrolysis), α-glucosidase (starch hydrolysis), β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase, protease (gelatin hydrolysis), trypsin and urease.

Acid is produced from 5-ketogluconate, d- and l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d- and l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, l-rhamnose, ribose, l-sorbose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, d-xylose, l-xylose, methyl α-d-glucoside, d-adonitol (ribitol), d-arabitol, dulcitol (galactitol), erythritol, glycerol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, xylitol, N-acetylglucosamine and arbutin; acid is not produced from 2-ketogluconate, gluconate, raffinose, d-tagatose, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, l-arabitol, amygdalin, aesculin, inulin, salicin, glycogen or starch.

The following substrates are utilized: 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, acetate, citrate, gluconate, lactate, l-malate, phenylacetate, propionate, n-valerate, l-arabinose, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, l-alanine, l-proline, malonate, l-rhamnose, sucrose, inositol, d-sorbitol, l-histidine, salicin, l-serine and N-acetylglucosamine.
The following substrates are not utilized: adipate, caprate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, itaconate, suberate, l-fucose, melibiose, d-ribose and glycogen.
The major fatty acids are summed feature 7 (comprising one or more of C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 1ω9c and C18 : 1ω12t), C18 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 58.7 mol%.
The type strain, MJ17T ( = KCTC 22480T = JCM 16385T = KEMB 9004-001T), was isolated from sludge at the Daejeon sewage disposal plant in Korea.
